item.title: 塔吉特降低 5000 种商品的价格，以吸引更多的购物者
item.description: 塔吉特（Target）是一家大卖场零售商，该公司周一表示，将对至少 5000 种经常购买的产品进行降价促销，这些产品包括牛奶和尿布等，以吸引预算紧张的顾客。【原文：Target will be lowering prices on at least 5,000 frequently shopped products across its assortment ranging from milk to diapers, the big-box retailer said on Monday, as it looks to attract budget-stretched customers.】

item.title: 摩根大通将 2024 年利息收入预期上调至 910 亿美元
item.description: 摩根大通周一上调了对净利息收入（NII）的预期，即贷款收入与存款支出之间的差额，将其上调至 910 亿美元（不包括市场）。【原文：JPMorgan Chase on Monday raised its forecast for net interest income (NII), or the difference between what it makes on loans and pays out on deposits, to $91 billion, excluding markets.】

item.title: 摩根大通领导层调整战略，接班人成为焦点
item.description: 在摩根大通周一的投资者日上，股东们将重点关注该银行的发展战略和继任计划。【原文：At JPMorgan Chase's investor day on Monday, shareholders will focus on the bank's growth strategy and succession plans.】

item.title: 德意志银行将标普 500 指数年终目标上调至 5500 点的最高水平
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）将 2024 年的 S&P 500 指数年终目标上调至 5500 点，在主要券商中居首位，并寄希望于强劲的企业盈利来支撑股票估值。【原文：Deutsche Bank has raised its 2024 year-end S&P 500 target to 5,500, the highest among major brokerages, banking on strong corporate earnings to support equity valuations.】

item.title: 谷歌投资 10 亿欧元建设芬兰数据中心，推动人工智能发展
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周一发表声明称，将再投资 10 亿欧元（11 亿美元）扩建其位于芬兰的数据中心园区，以推动其人工智能（AI）业务在欧洲的增长。【原文：Alphabet-owned Google will invest a further 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) into the expansion of its data centre campus in Finland to drive its artificial intelligence (AI) business growth in Europe, it said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 本周美联储会议纪要和英伟达业绩将助推期指上扬
item.description: 美国股指期货周一走高，英伟达（Nvidia）的季度业绩和美联储本周将公布的政策会议纪要可能会对华尔街破纪录的走势构成考验。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Monday, with Nvidia's quarterly results and the Federal Reserve's policy meeting minutes due this week likely to test Wall Street's record-breaking run.】

item.title: 美国 NHTSA 对 51,000 多辆大众电动汽车展开召回调查
item.description: 美国汽车安全监管机构周一表示，由于担心车辆在行驶过程中车门会打开，该机构已开始对大约5.15万辆大众美国电动汽车进行召回调查。【原文：The U.S. auto safety regulator said on Monday it has opened a recall query into an estimated 51,500 Volkswagen America's EVs over concerns of the vehicle door opening while driving.】

item.title: 早间竞价英伟达周 "伊始，热闹非凡
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 微软将在开发者大会前发布人工智能设备和功能
item.description: 微软计划于周一在其位于华盛顿州雷德蒙德（Redmond）的园区举行的一次活动中宣布几款与消费设备相关的硬件和软件。【原文：Microsoft plans to announce several pieces of hardware and software related to consumer devices on Monday at an event at its Redmond, Washington, campus.】

item.title: 路透社调查：今年中国房价和销售量下滑的情况将进一步恶化
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，随着房地产投资和销售下滑的加剧，今年中国的房价下跌速度将加快，这给正在加倍努力重振受危机影响的房地产行业的决策者们提了个醒。【原文：China's home prices will fall at a faster pace this year with worsening slumps in property investment and sales, a Reuters poll showed, a sombre reminder to policymakers as they redouble efforts to revive the crisis-hit property sector.】

item.title: 美国监管机构因安全带问题结束对特斯拉 Model X 的初步审查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周一表示，由于安全带问题，美国汽车安全监管机构结束了对某些 Model X 汽车的初步评估。【原文：The U.S. auto safety regulator closed the preliminary evaluation of certain Model X vehicles over seat belt issues, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Monday.】

item.title: 中国经济复苏乏力，1-4月财政收入下降2.7
item.description: 继1-3月下滑2.3%之后，2024年前四个月中国财政收入同比下滑2.7%，进一步表明经济复苏并不均衡。【原文：China's fiscal revenue slipped 2.7% in the first four months of 2024 from a year earlier, after a 2.3% slide in the January-March period, in a further sign of an uneven economic recovery.】

item.title: 沙特航空集团与空中客车公司达成沙特有史以来最大的喷气机交易
item.description: 沙特航空公司和廉价航空公司 flyadeal 的所有者沙特航空集团周一宣布订购 105 架空中客车窄体飞机，该公司总经理称这是沙特航空公司有史以来最大的一笔订单。【原文：Saudia Group, owner of the Saudia airline and budget carrier flyadeal, on Monday announced an order for 105 Airbus narrow-body aircraft in what the company's director general described as the largest ever order from a Saudi airline.】

item.title: 华为竞争激烈，苹果下调 iPhone 在华售价
item.description: 苹果公司在中国的天猫官方网站上推出了积极的打折活动，对部分 iPhone 机型提供高达 2,300 元（318 美元）的折扣。【原文：Apple has launched an aggressive discounting campaign on its official Tmall site in China, offering discounts of up to 2,300 yuan ($318) on select iPhone models.】

item.title: 奥迪与上汽合作开发中国专用电动车平台
item.description: 大众汽车旗下高端品牌奥迪周一表示，将与其中国合资伙伴上汽集团共同开发一个新的中国专用平台，用于智能和电动汽车。【原文：Volkswagen 's premium brand Audi said on Monday it would jointly develop a new China-specific platform for intelligent and electric vehicles with its Chinese joint venture partner SAIC .】

item.title: 华尔街对英伟达季度业绩寄予厚望
item.description: 华尔街押注英伟达（Nvidia）周三将发布一份井喷式的季度报告，其股价接近历史高点，因为投资者正在寻找证据，证明这家人工智能芯片制造商能够保持爆炸式增长，并领先于竞争对手。【原文：Wall Street is betting on a blowout quarterly report from Nvidia on Wednesday, with its stock near record highs as investors look for evidence that the AI chipmaker can maintain its explosive growth and stay ahead of rivals.】

item.title: 普拉达首席执行官表示，普拉达不考虑并购，但认为美国会带来 "积极的惊喜
item.description: 意大利奢侈品集团普拉达（Prada）首席执行官安德烈亚-格拉（Andrea Guerra）周一表示，普拉达不打算进行大规模收购，因为它专注于自己已经拥有的品牌。【原文：Italian luxury group Prada is not looking at big acquisitions as it is focused on the brands it already owns, its Chief Executive Andrea Guerra said on Monday.】

item.title: 红龙虾寻求破产保护，承诺融资 1 亿美元
item.description: 美国连锁餐厅 Red Lobster 周日表示，在获得现有贷款人 1 亿美元的融资承诺后，该公司已向佛罗里达州一家法院申请破产保护。【原文：U.S.-based restaurant chain Red Lobster has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in a Florida court after securing $100 million in financing commitments from its existing lenders, the company said on Sunday.】

item.title: 加密货币风险投资在长期下滑后回升
item.description: 周一的数据显示，2024年前三个月，全球对加密货币公司的风险投资增至24亿美元，这是投资者兴趣正在恢复的一个初步迹象。【原文：Global venture capital investment in crypto companies rose to $2.4 billion in the first three months of 2024, data showed on Monday, in a tentative sign that investor interest is returning.】

item.title: 美股交割转换面临早期弹性测试
item.description: 美国数万亿美元证券市场的参与者面临着一个早期考验，即他们是否有能力应对为加快交易结算而进行的监管改革，因为计划中的转换几天后就将进行一次重要的指数再平衡，这有可能导致失败交易激增。【原文：Participants in the United States' multitrillion-dollar securities markets face an early test of their ability to cope with regulatory reforms to speed up trade settlement, as a major index rebalance scheduled to occur just days after the planned switch risks causing a spike in failed trades.】

item.title: 独家报道特斯拉为欧洲车队买家提供损害控制和折扣优惠
item.description: 特斯拉正在努力安抚欧洲的一些租赁公司，因为这家汽车制造商一再降低零售价格，使他们的车队价值大跌，而其缓慢的服务和昂贵的维修费用也疏远了他们的企业客户。【原文：Tesla is working to appease some European leasing companies after the automaker’s repeated retail price cuts tanked their fleets’ value and its slow service and expensive repairs alienated their corporate customers.】

item.title: 商业游说团体称，日本顶级企业同意平均加薪 5.58
item.description: 日本经济团体联合会（Keidanren business lobby）周一的初步数据显示，在 3 月份结束的年度劳资谈判中，日本顶级企业同意平均加薪 5.58%，这是 33 年来最大的加薪幅度。【原文：Top Japanese companies agreed to wage increases of an average 5.58% at annual labour talks that wrapped up in March, the Keidanren business lobby's preliminary data showed on Monday, representing the heftiest pay hike in 33 years.】

item.title: 欧洲 投资者观望利率，金属价格上涨
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 印尼部长称马斯克将考虑在该国建设电动汽车电池厂的提议
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周一会见了印尼总统佐科-维多多（Joko Widodo），印尼投资统筹部长表示，埃隆-马斯克将考虑在印尼建设电动汽车电池厂的提议。【原文：Indonesia's coordinating minister of investment said that Elon Musk will consider an offer to build an electric vehicle battery plant in the country, after the CEO of Tesla met with President Joko Widodo on Monday.】

item.title: Pitchbook 称加密货币领域的风险投资资金增至 24 亿美元
item.description: Pitchbook 的数据显示，加密货币初创企业的融资额连续第二个季度上升，在 2024 年的前三个月达到 24 亿美元，原因是利率下调的预期和美国首个比特币现货 ETF 的首次亮相吊足了投资者的胃口。【原文：Crypto startup funding rose for a second straight quarter to hit $2.4 billion in the first three months of 2024, Pitchbook data showed, as expectations of lower interest rates and the debut of the first U.S. bitcoin spot ETF whetted investor appetite.】

item.title: 中国商务部禁止部分美国公司从事进出口活动
item.description: 中国商务部周一表示，将禁止一些美国公司从事与中国有关的进出口活动，其中包括一家向台湾出售武器的公司，并禁止这些公司在中国进行新的投资。【原文：China's Commerce Ministry said on Monday that it will prohibit some U.S. firms from importing and exporting activities related to China, including one selling arms to Taiwan, and forbid them from making new investments in China.】

item.title: 尽管有最新支持措施，但大多数中国开发商股价下跌
item.description: 即使在中国宣布采取 "历史性 "措施稳定受危机影响的房地产行业之后，周一中国大多数主要开发商的股价仍然下跌。【原文：Shares of most major Chinese developers fell on Monday even after China announced "historic" steps to stabilise its crisis-hit property sector.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，埃利奥特在江森自控建立了超过 10 亿美元的股份关系
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周日报道，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已在江森自控国际有限公司（Johnson Controls International Plc）建立了价值超过 10 亿美元的仓位。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a position worth over $1 billion in Johnson Controls International Plc, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 伊朗总统命运未卜，油价攀升
item.description: 油价周一在亚洲早盘交易中上涨，延续了上周的涨势，原因是伊朗总统乘坐的直升机在这个产油国坠毁，救援人员正在搜寻伊朗总统，而且美国购买原油帮助伊朗补充国家库存。【原文：Oil prices rose in early Asian trading on Monday, adding to last week's gains as rescuers searched for Iran's president after a helicopter crash in the oil-producing nation and after the U.S. bought crude to help refill the national stockpile.】

item.title: 美元持稳，交易员等待美国加息路径的线索
item.description: 美元周一基本持稳，因为投资者在美联储官员发表谨慎言论后，等待进一步的线索来帮助勾画美国的利率路径，即使通胀有降温迹象。【原文：The dollar was broadly steady on Monday as investors awaited further clues to help chart the U.S. interest rate path in the wake of cautious comments from Federal Reserve officials, even as inflation shows signs of cooling.】
